What does 2,544 quarters, 3,985 dimes, 2,704 nickels, 15,609 pennies and 881 dollar bills give you? The most successful coin drive ever held by Springville Elementary’s Student Council.

Between February 3rd and 13th a total of $2206.79 was tossed into 31 fishbowls and pond within the lobby of the elementary school. The drive collected funds to support the Springville Community Trout Pond Renovation Project.

The student council would like to thank the teachers and staff of Springville Elementary who matched the total collected from the coin toss, as well as, M&T Bank who kindly counted the money.

Now you know why the trout are smiling in Springville!

SGI looking for bus drivers-
Discover if School Bus Driving is Right for You

If you can answer yes to any of these questions, maybe school bus driving is the career you’ve been looking for!

Do you have great people skills and are you calm under pressure?
Do you enjoy working with children and is the safety of children important to you?
Do you enjoy driving? How about an office with a view?
Would a flexible work schedule be ideal for you? How about a job with benefits?

If you answered yes to these questions, contact the Springville Griffith CSD transportation department for more details.

We offer:

On-site training
Competitive salary and benefits
Flexible family friendly schedule
Opportunities for continued professional growth
Friendly work atmosphere
Contact the Springville Griffith Institute CSD Transportation Department at 716-592-3278. The Transportation Department is located at 369 North St. in Springville, NY.
